abstract: A representation of an item from a report descriptor for a HID device.
overview:
## Overview

A [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDElement] is an abstraction for the data in a HID report, and represents one item of data that could be sent or received in a report for a specific device. For example, for a mouse with a report descriptor that declares a report with 1 byte of data for each an X and a Y coordinate, there would be an element for the data associated with the X coordinate. If this element was monitored by a [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDDeviceClient], when an input report was received with an update to the X coordinate, a notification with the updated data would be sent to [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDDeviceClient/Notification/elementUpdates(values:)].

Elements are only received by requesting the elements for a specific device through a client’s [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDDeviceClient/elements] property.

See the HID specification for more details: [https://www.usb.org/hid].

# HIDElement

**Structure**

A representation of an item from a report descriptor for a HID device.

## Declaration

```swift
struct HIDElement
```

## Overview

A [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDElement] is an abstraction for the data in a HID report, and represents one item of data that could be sent or received in a report for a specific device. For example, for a mouse with a report descriptor that declares a report with 1 byte of data for each an X and a Y coordinate, there would be an element for the data associated with the X coordinate. If this element was monitored by a [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDDeviceClient], when an input report was received with an update to the X coordinate, a notification with the updated data would be sent to [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDDeviceClient/Notification/elementUpdates(values:)].

Elements are only received by requesting the elements for a specific device through a client’s [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDDeviceClient/elements] property.

See the HID specification for more details: [https://www.usb.org/hid].

## Structures

- **HIDElement.Value**: Data associated with a HID element.

## Instance Properties

- **client**: The client for the device with which this element is associated.
- **logicalMaximum**: The logical maximum for this element’s data.
- **logicalMinimum**: The logical minimum for this element’s data.
- **parentCollection**: The [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDElementCollection] that contains this element.
- **physicalMaximum**: The physical maximum for this element’s data.
- **physicalMinimum**: The physical minimum for this element’s data.
- **reportID**: The report ID for the report that contains this element.
- **reportSize**: The size in bits of the data for this element.
- **type**: The type of this element.
- **unit**: The HID specification compliant unit code for this element.
- **unitExponent**: The calculated exponent for this element.
- **usage**: The HID specification compliant usage for this element.

## Interaction

- **Communicating with human interface devices**: Interact with and obtain data from devices such as keyboards and mice.
- **HIDDeviceClient**: A client of a physical or virtual HID compatible peripheral.
- **HIDElementCollection**: A collection of items from a report descriptor for a HID device.
- **HIDElement.Value**: Data associated with a HID element.
- **HIDElementUpdate**: A base protocol for element update types.
- **HIDReportType**: Types for HID reports.
- **HIDReportID**: A type to represent the report IDs of HID reports.
- **HIDUsage**: A type to represent HID usage pages.
- **HIDDeviceError**: Errors that the framework can throw.
- **HIDDeviceTransport**: Common transport types that transmit data to or from a HID device.
- **HIDDeviceLocalizationCode**: The localization codes that some HID devices declare to specify conformance to a certain format or language.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
